law.catch_line: Taxes on property sold at judicial sale.
law.text: The court may, in actions for sale of real property, determine summarily, with or without written pleadings, the amount of any state, city or district taxes or assessments upon the property to be sold, and shall provide for their payment in the judgment. If the judgment does not so provide, the purchaser shall be entitled, at any time before the payment of the purchase price, to a credit for the amount of the taxes and assessments.
law.history: Recodified 1942 Ky. Acts ch. 208, sec. 1, effective October 1, 1942, from Ky. Stat. sec. 989.
